data.title: PU particle billboard TEXTURE_COORDS rotate type logic error
Stop removing .lua and .luac at the end of filename in LuaLoader
data.body: I've preformed some research and testing, so now you can safely stop this. Previous discussion and reasons you can found here: #18171. Note, that it MAY break some cocos-lua based projects, but there is trivial fix: do not use `.lua` and `.luac` directly in `require`.

data.title: a
data.body: a

data.title: Crash on Timeline::~Timeline
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: multiple Android devices from Crashlytics

I am getting crashes on crashlytics dashboard related to Timeline::~Timeline(). I have looked into the code and confirmed that from all places i am creating ActionTimelines are autoreleased objects and i am not releasing them. 
However few users are getting the crash on scene switching OR when we call "cocostudio::timeline::ActionTimelineCache::getInstance()->purge();" It Looks like to me that there is some object in stack for Timeline object which becomes dangling and cause crash when Timeline deallocates and it tries to release its stacked objects. I am also attaching the Crash log please let me know if there is anything i could have done wrong OR is this you guys can fix? Thanks for all the help.

[crashlog-2.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/1260107/crashlog-2.txt)

data.title: wrong parse for lua search path
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest
- devices test on: any
- developing environments
   - NDK version: any
   - Xcode version: any
   - VS version: any
   - browser type and version: any

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  in file:  cocos2d-x/cocos/scripting/lua-bindings/manual/Cocos2dxLuaLoader.cpp
2.  at about line 80: 
         std::string prefix = searchpath.substr(begin, next);

It will parse out a wrong path for prefix,
Should replace it with: 
         std::string prefix = searchpath.substr(begin, next - begin);

parameters for C++ string.substr should be (startPos, len), but not (startPos, endPos)

data.title: renderTexture->saveToFile() bugged for image alpha values
Fix bug of returning UNKNOWN event for return type key SEARCH/SEND in EditBox.
data.body:
If you set and `EditBox` return type to `SEARCH` (Android and iOS) or `SEND` (Android) and click on the corresponding keyboard button, you get `UNKNOWN` event.

This pull request fixes this issue.

data.title: CMake build on Ubuntu 14.04 not working
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest v3 from git   (e79f21c)
- devices test on: Kubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
- developing environments CMake

Seems like the CMake build on Ubuntu 14.04 is broken due to link errors.

First error: 
```
/usr/bin/ld: /home/user/sw/build/cocos2dx/source/external/websockets/prebuilt/linux/64-bit/libwebsockets.a(libwebsockets.c.o): unrecognized relocation (0x2a) in section `.text'
/usr/bin/ld: final link failed: Bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```
This seems to be caused by using a version of `binutils` which is too new and incompatible with 2.24

Second error:
There are linking errors when building `CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp` in respect to GLFW3, I think the are no proper references to the custom built GLFW (built and installed by install-linux-deps.sh)
